remove().Description: Removes the header that was returned last.

Returns: true if the header should be part of the iteration, false to skip
Parameters: the index of the header to check
filterHeader(int).Description: Checks whether a header is part of the iteration.

Returns: the next header in this iteration
Throws: if there are no more headers
nextHeader().Description: Obtains the next header from this iteration.

Parameters: a list of headers over which to iterate
the name of the headers over which to iterate, or null for any

Returns: the next header in this iteration
Throws: if there are no more headers
next().Description: Returns the next header. Same as @B_org#apache#http#message#BasicListHeaderIterator#nextHeader_E@, but not type-safe.

Returns: the index of the next header that matches the filter name, or negative if there are no more headers
Parameters: one less than the index to consider first, -1 to search for the first header
findNext(int).Description: Determines the index of the next header.

Returns: true if there is another header, false otherwise
hasNext().Description: Indicates whether there is another header in this iteration.

ClassDesc: Please use @B_java#net#URL#openConnection_E@ instead. Please visit Implementation of a @B_org#apache#http#HeaderIterator_E@ based on a @B_java#util#List_E@. For use by @B_org#apache#http#message#HeaderGroup_E@.
